segments.text: Looking at the boy on that stool makes my heart race.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s so focused, reaching for those cookies, it’s almost comical.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the stool is so wobbly; it’s a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but think about how the woman hasn’t even glanced over her shoulder.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle of water is slowly spreading underfoot, a silent warning.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so eager, her palm open, waiting for a treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a sweet moment but feels like walking a tightrope of chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their little heist is thrilling—if only they knew the risks involved.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find myself smiling at their determination, yet my heart sinks with worry.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Part of me wants to intervene, but another part cherishes this childhood moment.
segments.speaker: PAR
